revised_title: A New Method for Correcting Squinting and Improving Vision
tldr: The author describes a new method for treating squinting and improving vision by using a gnomon and exercises to train the eyes. The method involves wearing a device that projects an inch and a half in front of the nose and practicing with blackened wooden sticks to gradually improve eye coordination. The author also discusses the insensitivity of the central part of the optic nerve and its possible causes.
